Reviews.Title: Remove 2 Sound Drivers before running Windows Update!
Reviews.Author: CTP
Reviews.Content: The Windows Update issue is related to a conflict between the sound drivers and one of the updates. Uninstall 2 sound drivers and run Windows update. The drivers will re-install themselves automatically on reboot.

Reviews.Title: Great for Running Lots of Programs- Fast!
Reviews.Author: Teacher614
Reviews.Content: I also bought mine and Staples for use in my classroom and I love it!  The Windows 8 is really neat for organizing the programs you have open.  It's easy to manage. I use this computer and run 4-5 large programs at a time and it is extremely fast!  The tech man at my school recommended this specific computer since it has a 4core and I'm so glad I went with this one.  Plus the screen is large and very vibrant.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Terry
Reviews.Content: I play Call of Duty Black Ops II in medium settings @45-60fps.I have also played Battlefield 3 in medium-low settings just fine.(doesnt draw fps so i dont know extacly what fps)I use Adobe Photoshop CS6 as well as Premiere and After Effects.Plays 1080p video perfectly (my old computer couldnt)Unless you are using a 3d program to render full 3d scenes i dont think you would have any problem for Video and photo editing, and light to medium gaming.Also I use this computer paired with a Laptop Cooler (any). It brings the temp down about 10c and runs faster.Also if you use something like Razr Game Booster, or something that will allow you to close down background services it will improve your gaming.CONS:Only thing I do not like is the screen. I edit photos and I feel if I dont have the screen at a perfect 90degrees, the colors and lightness/darkness in pictures changes. So I dont feel I can get an accurate edit of the photo.Maybe I will upgrade to an HD monitor to pair with this laptop

Reviews.Title: Programers beware
Reviews.Author: Hannahzarah Avarraschild "Hannah"
Reviews.Content: The keyboard of this laptop doesn't have a pause/break key. This means that ctrl+break doesn't work. When I called HP support they told me that HP hadn't provided for this function. No big deal to people who aren't programers but if you are running code and need to interrupt it or accidentally create an endless loop you have to stop the parent program using task manager--not the best solution.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop
Reviews.Author: MIke Nguyen
Reviews.Content: I was very happy when I first got it, the specs are fantastic for the price and meets my needs greatly.The RAM and processor is really good for my gaming needs, and it just looks fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Like it
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Cline
Reviews.Content: having trouble getting used to windows 8 but it is ok. I couldn't get an external drive to work on it, though.

Reviews.Title: great little computer
Reviews.Author: Robert Ward
Reviews.Content: this is a great little computer for the money! Except for the windows 8 its great.  Im thinking about putting 7 back on it so that its easier to use!!

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: This is my first laptop I've ever owned, and I love it. It's a little big, but I like the big screen. I'm still trying to get used to Windows 8, though. I would definitely recommend this laptop.

Reviews.Title: Woowwww is amazing
Reviews.Author: Geldon
Reviews.Content: Great Laptop, great shiping.Very fast and i love 17.3 inch desktop.I'm still learning windows 8 but it looks nice.

Reviews.Title: awesomness!
Reviews.Author: javs
Reviews.Content: I don't know why others would rate this product anything less than 5 stars. The laptop works great! It just takes a lot to get used to windows 8... I need to take a tutorial!

Reviews.Title: You Are Stuck with Windows 8 so you better like it
Reviews.Author: Anthony F. Valone
Reviews.Content: This my first Windows 8 computer --- purchased for my wife.  I dislike Windows 8, she hates Windows 8.  HP Support says you are stuck with Windows 8.  You can not downgrade to Windows 7.  They will sell you the Windows 7 disc but will provide you NO DRIVERS to support Win 7.  You must get drives from the manufacturers of each of the components HP puts into the notebook.  If you downgrade support and warranty are void.So...it's good hardware and value.  Beware before you buy-----love windows 8!

Reviews.Title: horrible experience
Reviews.Author: Civil War Buff
Reviews.Content: The computer I purchased has internet/software issues. On the surface everything appeared to work great but I too have experienced MAJOR download problems with Window's updates, HP downloads (which you sometimes have to do multiple times for them to take), problems downloading new drivers for printers...I have learned every time I put anything on the computer to check the web to make sure it is working correctly. Computer has already undergone two crashes to try and fix problems (computer purchased in Dec.). I now cannot use my printer because I tried to print something off the web and uninstall and reinstalling the printer did not solve the problem. Window's 8 may look pretty but it certainly does not work well on my computer.

Reviews.Title: Amazing ♥
Reviews.Author: JaviDeJesus
Reviews.Content: Is very quiet, and very fast process, I can runnings this games: Battlefield 3,4, Far Cry 3, DMC 5, Sniper Ghost Warrior 2, Dead Island, etc.. and more games... in medium setting.

Reviews.Title: But be Warned! (Cannot maintain near 2.8 GHz)
Reviews.Author: Joy Feliz Tait
Reviews.Content: A great deal, but not nearly as stellar as I thought it would be.Make sure you know how an AMD Accelerated processor/CPU works; it cannot maintain it's max accelerated speed (assuming it can reach it) for any significant length of time.  Mine seems to be able to maintain about 2.2 GHz or so (maybe ~2.4) when ventilated well (it slows down if objects are close to the vents).  Also, I recommend knowing what you're getting into when you get Windows 8.(the following 3 paragraphs are really about Windows 8, so feel free to skip them and move on to "I was reluctant...")I've had this computer (and Windows 8) for over a month, and from my experience, Windows 8 saves itself by supposedly having anything that works on Windows 7 work also on Windows 8 (Though it seems to meet this goal quite well, I'm experiencing some or several difficulties (mostly online) that would not be occurring with Windows 7).It seems Windows 8 is not really a big step forward, and tries to envelope Windows 7 inside it so it has a fallback anywhere needed, which is very important since it seems to me that most Windows 8 programs are premature/underdeveloped (or don't exist for Windows 8 yet); I just install and use the Windows 7 versions.  (Skype is a great example, as the Windows 8 version's functionality is (or was) poor (signal loss issues and poor video) and very limited, but I haven't had Skype problems after installing Windows 7 Skype and uninstalling Windows 8 Skype.With that said, aside from little issues here and there, Windows 8 does seem quite user friendly (in perspective of how complicated they/computers are).I was reluctant to give 5 stars (primarily) because the biggest selling point advantage this computer had for me was the quad 2.8GHz that I thought I could set the computer to consistently run at, or that the computer would run at whenever there was enough demand; and that turned out to be false.  I felt like giving only 2 stars after learning that, but it was my own misunderstanding; I'm generally happy with the computer, and wouldn't have been able to get a much better deal elsewhere online at the time (I did my research) for the price (my purchase on approx. Jan. 11th, 2013 totaled $498 w/shipping).The only other complaint of any significance I can think of is difficulty with the touchpad reading my fingers properly sometimes, but that might be a personal problem instead of the product; I'm not sure which.  Everything else seems to work great.This review was written by my husband, who chose and uses the computer practically every day (usually for several hours), and who is a fairly advanced computer user.

Reviews.Title: great laptop!
Reviews.Author: Austin
Reviews.Content: with a amd a8 and a 17 inch screen, this laptop is great. keeping it for a long time. the company is great too and helped me out alot

Reviews.Title: Hp Compaq  with AMD Quad-Core A8 processor
Reviews.Author: Partha Bhadra
Reviews.Content: This is a very good laptop computer with heavy duty computing power. I mostly use it for Math calculations with MS Excel.

Reviews.Title: Nice laptop from HP
Reviews.Author: Val Weaver
Reviews.Content: i think this is a very good product. I like it alot. easy to use and reliable. i would recommend to buy this item if you are looking for a budget friendly good system.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Rufdog "Total Jam Old Skool"
Reviews.Content: First of all I like HP. Products, This is why I chose this laptop. Its easy to learn and use. I defiantly would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: EXCELENT LAPTOP
Reviews.Author: Carlos Suarez
Reviews.Content: I RECOMMEND THIS LAPTOP WITH THE BLIND EYES. BUY IT AND ENYOY THE SPEED, STABILITY OF WINDOWS 8. GREAT COMPUTER. FULL FRIENDLY.

Reviews.Title: Bought it for my Dad
Reviews.Author: Bisonte
Reviews.Content: Large screen, bright, nice key board, don't like the touch pad so I recommend a wireless mouse.  Windows 8 takes some getting used to though...
